name: Pomodoro Technique
description: Work for 25 minutes, break for 5. After 4 cycles, take a longer break.

name: Flowtime Technique
description: Work until tired, then rest. Track time naturally without timers.

name: Timeboxing
description: Allocate fixed time blocks to tasks. Commit to stop once time is up.

name: Eisenhower Matrix
description: Prioritize tasks by urgency and importance.

name: Getting Things Done (GTD)
description: Capture, clarify, organize, reflect, and engage.

name: 2-Minute Rule
description: If it takes less than 2 minutes, do it immediately.

name: Eat That Frog
description: Tackle your hardest task first thing in the morning.

name: Don't Break the Chain
description: Mark each day you complete a task on a calendar and build streaks.

name: Zen to Done (ZTD)
description: Simplified GTD focusing on habits and mindfulness.

name: ABCDE Prioritization
description: Label tasks A to E by importance and do them in order.

name: SMART Goals
description: Set Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound goals.

name: The ONE Thing
description: Focus on the single most important task.

name: MITs (Most Important Tasks)
description: List and do your top 3 most important tasks first.

name: Ultradian Rhythms
description: Work in 90-minute cycles followed by 20-minute breaks.

name: Digital Minimalism
description: Reduce time spent on digital distractions.

name: Deep Work
description: Block uninterrupted time for cognitively demanding work.

name: Parkinson’s Law
description: Work expands to fill the time available. Use tight deadlines.

name: Biological Prime Time
description: Work during your most energetic hours.

name: Bullet Journaling
description: Combine calendar, task list, and diary into one analog system.

name: Mind Mapping
description: Visual way to brainstorm and organize ideas.
